Award.AwardTitle: Free Probability and the Large N Limit IV
Award.AbstractNarration:
This award provides funding to help defray the expenses of participants in the conference "Free Probability and the Large N Limit IV" that will be held March 25-29, 2014, on the campus of the University of California-Berkeley.

This event is the fourth in a series of workshops that have focused on the subject of free probability, an important area closely tied to the theory of operator algebras. The meeting will bring together and foster collaborations amongst researchers from the following fields: free probability; operator algebras; random matrix theory; probability theory; subfactor theory; combinatorics. The conference program provides ample opportunity for graduate students, postdocs, and other young scientists to present their work.

POR.DRECONTENT:
In free probability theory the random variables, like the observables in quantum mechanics are Hilbert space operators, but the notion of independence is modelled on free products instead of tensor products. The theory has important connections with random matrices in the large N limit, operator algebras and the combinatorics of non-crossing partitions. In addition to these the analogy to classical probability has been paramount in guiding the research. Because of the different kinds of expertise involved, meetings like the "Free Probability and the Large N Limit IV", which was held at UC Berkeley (March 25 - 29, 2014)  
provide the necessary interaction between the different sides of the subject. Participation in such meetings is very important for researchers in this field and especially for the young mathematicians entering the field, since this is a very good opportunity to meet other researchers in this field, learn, communicate, present their results. The major goal of the project was to partially support travel and accommodation, especially for young mathematicians to attend the workshop. Residual funds were then used to provide the same kind of partial support for young mathematicians to attend a related free probability theory event at UC Berkeley, the Extended Probabilistic Operator Algebra Seminar (May 8-11, 2015). The grant provided support towards the travel and accommodation expenses of
17 mathematicians (11 juniors and 6 seniors) participating in the "Free Probability and the Large N Limit IV" workshop. The residual funds provided support towards the accommodation  and travel expenses of 7 young mathematicians to participate in the Extended Probabilistic Operator Algebra Seminar organized by D. Shlyakhtenko and the PI.  All the mathematicians who received support from the grant gave talks at the event they attended. The support provided by the grant had the desired impact in the development of the young mathematicians, an excellent professional development and training opportunity and made a human resources contribution. These events also had important impact in developing the field of free probability. The workshop "Free Probability and the Large N Limit IV" was organized by Alice Guionnet (MIT), Dimitri Shlyakhtenko (UCLA) and the PI.
